text:
Hey Guys

I have one query
I would like to ask you guys if you have any idea on how I can solve that issue
I want to show the tags and the image for the latest post
this is my code right now, I got this code from the documentation
this is the code for the tags from the documentation
this is my design idea
and here is the entire code for that section
so please can you help me out
Guys I’m wanting to add an active class on the first item of a loop. Is this possible?
{% if loop.first %}Classname{% endif %}
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/for-loops>
Thank you :raised_hands:
Just read this on a monday. It is now a good Monday :100:

<@UHE8JR508> We’ve got some updates to the search modules that will be released very soon. Currently the best way to add options would be to clone the modules and add the functionality that you need either in the HTML/HubL or the JS itself.

If you’d like to adjust the actual search request, you can clone the Search Input module and add hidden `<inputs>` for most of the supported parameters (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>)

If you’d like to adjust the output of the results you can change/add CSS, edit the structure of the `<template>` (maintaining classNames) or if you’d like to add things like featured images, you’ll need to edit the JS itself
Anyone have their CMS go down today?
no but slow at the moment
Between 7-730 this morning 2 of the CMS sites including our own went up and down according to pingdom
<https://techcrunch.com/2019/06/24/cloudflare-outage-affecting-numerous-sites-on-monday-am/>
Ah ok, thank you Matt, I figured it was odd that the ones that went down were all based in a certain area
<https://status.HubSpot.com/> if you look at the system metrics you can see when the issue started and ended

If you are interested in details, or even possibly helping out we are coordinating in <#CCGU4R4ER|extend>

While we are still working out details, 1 thing we intend to have are dev focused presentations from community devs and also hopefully HubSpot staff as well.

The poll above is to get an initial number of attendees so we can figure out rough accommodation needs. An RSVP might be needed at a later time, to ensure we have enough room and supplies.
is there an RSS feed link I can use for the HubSpot status? I was going to hook this up to our dev-ops channel in slack so we can get notified of issues
Found it: <https://status.HubSpot.com/history.rss>
may have a +1, but unsure

Tagging everyone I know who has expressed interest or attended last year’s dev meetup.

too bad I can’t edit the poll after the fact :disappointed: to add a +1 +2. If you might be bringing a +1 please comment stating such
Make a digitally accessible option! I want to 'attend' but I have to be in NYC that weekend :disappointed:
Alas
that is something we are talking through, this poll is more to gauge in-person attendees. online attendees we don’t really need to poll
<@UDFTHC6PK> we will send some google glass your way
schwatevs <@U7SL518D6> digital people matter :wink:
oh god.
just have to promise to wear it while you are in the city
I think that option is #2
unsure if I can make it right now but want to go

Adding clarification to above poll. This is for physical attendees.  We hope to include people who can only attend virtually as well, no concrete plans on that yet. If you know you won’t be there in person but would attend virtually please answer “no I will for sure not be physically attending”

This poll is to get an initial head count to figure out how much room we need and rough estimate of supplies needed.

:wave: This is amazing! I think we're definitely open to digital events in the future. We know not everyone can travel all the time, so this is a first step, being lead by our community members. We haven't had high attendance for virtual AMAs in the past so we decided to pause those while we rethink and really focus on the core foundation of the overall developer experience itself (tooling, resources, etc). if there's interest in other events, webinars, etc, we're definitely open to hearing more and trying experiments whenever possible to support you all.
I would probably end up attending this even over the actual Inbound conf
Anyone out there using third party A/B testing app on HubSpot sites?  Looking to roll out a few tests, but wondering if there's better value out there than upgrading to marketing hub professional
<https://optimize.google.com/optimize/home/>
havent used it on HS specifically but did on a WP site once, seemed good to go
I’ve also used it on a WP site and it was pretty great. Simple, configurable, granular controls.
Nice.  Thanks guys
Wow.  So far, this is incredibly easy to set up.
Exciting to see the responses to the poll. If you think other people in your team are going tag them so they can vote up. Also feel free to note +1's Unfortunately this polling tool didn’t have that.
